channel.title: Help shud be eazy prob
channel.description: how do i move items like a prayer alter?

item.title: Help shud be eazy prob
item.dc:creator: @bballin24 bballin24
item.description:
@bballin24 wrote:

[quote=“cr4ck3rb4ck, post:4, topic:320267”][quote author=suppyscape link=topic=416751.msg3064522#msg3064522 date=1261112406]
In client.java search “makeGlobalObject(OBJECT ID OF THE OBJECT YOU WANT TO MOVE, X-COORD OF THE OBJECT, Y-COORD OF THE OBJECT, -3, 10);// Anvil”

change the x and y coords to where you want the object to be
[/quote]

like wht suppyscae said just add it under makeglobalobject like this:
Makeglobalobject(xxxx, yyyy, id, 0, 10;

xxxx= x pos
yyyy= y pos
id=objects id (try searching google for a list
0= face west -1= face north -2= face east -3= face south
10 = global object (e.g if i were to make it 1 it would become a wall object)

hope that helps a bit more aswell =)[/quote]

thx that helps a ton

Read full topic

item.title: Help shud be eazy prob

item.description:
@cr4ck3rb4ck wrote:

[quote=“suppyscape, post:2, topic:320267”]In client.java search “makeGlobalObject(OBJECT ID OF THE OBJECT YOU WANT TO MOVE, X-COORD OF THE OBJECT, Y-COORD OF THE OBJECT, -3, 10);// Anvil”

change the x and y coords to where you want the object to be[/quote]

like wht suppyscae said just add it under makeglobalobject like this:
Makeglobalobject(xxxx, yyyy, id, 0, 10;

xxxx= x pos
yyyy= y pos
id=objects id (try searching google for a list
0= face west -1= face north -2= face east -3= face south
10 = global object (e.g if i were to make it 1 it would become a wall object)

hope that helps a bit more aswell =)
